SMW Subobject for Well of Souls, Rasial's CitadelNPC ID: 30172, 30255Options: ExamineExamine: The so-called 'Spirit of War'.Release date: 7 August 2023NPC location: Well of Souls, Rasial's CitadelIs members only: trueIs variant of: Hermod, the Spirit of War

Hermod, the Spirit of War is a boss and a lieutenant of Rasial, the First Necromancer. He is a phantom born out of the unending conflicts of the God Wars in the Third Age, and continuously reforms himself when destroyed as long as wars are waged on Gielinor. Rasial made him his bodyguard by convincing him that the only way to stop conflict once and for all is by enacting his plan to end all life and break the cycle of death. The boss encounter with Hermod is available after completing The Spirit of War quest. During the quest, players need to face him in order to access Rasial's Citadel above the City of Um in the Underworld.[1]

He is designed to be the more approachable of the two, with power similar to the original God Wars Dungeon bosses.[2]

Hermod is a phantom, meaning that he's affected by the undead slayer effect, such as from the salve amulet and the Undead Slayer perk. However, he's not affected by ghost hunter equipment as he's not a ghost. Deathtouched darts do not work on him. He doesn't count towards any Slayer assignment.

Obtaining all unique drops from this encounter completes the achievement War, huh. What is it good for?, unlocking the title [Name], the Spirit of War.

He is also fought during Alpha vs Omega where the player needs to defeat him before facing Rasial, the First Necromancer. In both The Spirit of War and Alpha vs Omega Hermod, the Spirit of War is fought in story mode with halved life points and reduced damage output.

Selecting the "teleport" option in the Beasts interface for Hermod, the Spirit of War casts the Home Teleport spell to the City of Um lodestone. Once there, Kharen in the north-western part of the city can transport the player to outside Rasiel's Citadel.

Hermod, the Spirit of War does not drop charms.

Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Hermodic plate11/10; 1/9[d 1][3]100,000100,000

  1. ^ Drop rate of Hermodic plate is increased to 1/9 with tier 3 luck or higher.
  2. ^ The chance to receive the drumsticks increases with every kill. They become a guaranteed drop after a number of kills (at least 64, the exact number is unknown).
  3. ^ Hermod's armour spike has a drop rate of 1/2,000 with a threshold of 400.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • hidden 16 October 2023 (Update):
    • Can now be fought on free-to-play worlds.
  • update 7 August 2023 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The Guthixian runes on his sword, Angurvadal, read "anguish" (ᛆᚿᚵᚢᛁᛍᚼ). They are upside down though, and can be read properly by flipping the image vertically (not rotating).
  • In Norse mythology, Hermod (Hermóðr) is a son of Odin who is sent to the underworld to seek his brother Baldr. After Baldr is killed by his blind brother Hodr via, in some sources, Loki's trickery, his mother Frigg begs someone to go to the underworld Niflheim and bring him back to the realm of the living. Hermod volunteers and rides Odin's eight-legged steed Sleipnir for nine nights before arriving at Hel's hall. There he sees Baldr sitting at the high seat and asks Hel to release him. She tells him that Baldr will only be freed if all living things weep for him. Hermod returns to Asgard with this message, and the gods send envoys across the world asking all to weep. And they do, except for a single giantess named Thokk (Þökk, "Thanks"), believed by many to be Loki in disguise. Thus Baldr remains in the underworld, his death heralding the coming of Ragnarok, the apocalyptic ending of the world.
  • When smashing the ground, Hermod will sometimes say "Grrr.. ..arrrh!", a reference to the Mutant Enemy production company, which uses a zombie in their end-of-credits logo that says the same.
